Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the prevalence of rape by stating that nearly one in five women in America has been a victim of rape or attempted rape.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient support as it is based on a survey conducted by the CDC, which may have limitations in terms of methodology and sample size.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the definition and categorization of rape used in the survey accurately represent the experiences of all women.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors that contribute to the reported statistics, such as the possibility of re-victimization or the lower response rate in web-based surveys.
